title: DayZ
notes: Stable branch is not working, probably because of the use of BattleEye Anti-Cheat. But in the experimental branch and started in offline-mode (alternative start option of DayZ) it is working just fine with around 70% of native performance.

title: DayZ
notes:
Proof: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ba8FxYJC-pw
Performance: Performs about 50% worse
Workarounds required: https://github.com/Jacob-Mango/DayZ-Linux

title: DayZ
notes:
***Only DayZ Offline mode on `experimental - Unstable testing version` branch is working***
- The game in offline mode works pretty good and out of the box.
- Performance is mediocre if not terrible (but I don't have Windows atm to compare how bad native performance is ;))
- Fullscreen/windowed mode works
- Alt tabbing works (sometimes in windowed mode after minimizing you have to alttab in and out to make it catch the correct resolution)
- Steam Overlay and Screenshots work
- But: USB mouse is terribly "heavy", it moves veeery slowly (like with very low acceleration, sens. in settings doesn't do much)
- What's weird - touchpad mouse works just fine
- Windowed mode runs slightly better, but there is no borderless option
- You can kinda fix mouse with: 
env WINEPREFIX="/..../steamapps/compatdata/221100/pfx/" WINEPATH="/..../steamapps/common/Proton 3.7/dist/bin/wine64" winecfg
And in "Wine Configuration" -> "Graphics" tab ->  enable "Automatically capture the mouse in full-screen windows" + enable "Virtual Desktop" (e.g. 1920x1080) and mouse after this kinda works fine -> Apply
- I haven't found zombies during ~30 minutes but suicide works :v Don't know how performance would be on native Windows but it's pretty bad here
- Trying to play "normal" (online) DayZ fails with Battleye error "Failed to initialize BattlEye Service: Driver Load Error (31)"

To sum up: Decided to call it "Stable" because it, well, works. But only experimental offline version, performance is mediocre and there are some fixable mouse problems.
